sentences.en: According to psychologist Martin Lloyd-Elliott, 90 per cent of communication between people is non-verbal.
sentences.cn: 根据心理学家马丁·劳埃德·埃利奥特的研究，人们之间90％的交流是非语言的。

sentences.en: Ask your doctor for a referral to a clinical psychologist.
sentences.cn: 让你的医生给你推荐一位临床心理学家。

sentences.en: Dr. Sinclair is a child psychologist.
sentences.cn: 辛克莱博士是一位儿童心理学专家.

sentences.en: He fancies himself a bit of a psychologist.
sentences.cn: 他自以为有一点心理学家的天分.

sentences.en: He is now a consultant psychologist with a major London hospital.
sentences.cn: 他现时在伦敦一家大医院里担任心理学顾问.

sentences.en: He passed himself off as a senior psychologist.
sentences.cn: 他冒充成资深心理学家。

sentences.en: He practises as a clinical psychologist.
Last night a top criminal psychologist cast doubt on the theory.
sentences.cn: 昨天晚上，一位顶级犯罪心理学家使人们对该理论产生了怀疑。

sentences.en: Or, what Stanford University psychologist Claude M. Steele, who is black, refers to as'stereotype vulnerability.
sentences.cn: 或者, 用斯坦福大学的黑人心理学家克劳迪-M-斯蒂尔的话说, 这是一种“定型的脆弱性”.

sentences.en: Psychologist Richard Allen, co - director of the Johns Hopkins Center, considers insomnia a 24 - hour disorder.
sentences.cn: 心理学家理查德-艾伦是约翰 - 霍布金斯失眠治疗中心的联席主任, 他认为失眠症属于24小时神经失调症.

sentences.en: Take Jeffrey Goldstein , a psychologist at Utrecht University in the Netherlands.
sentences.cn: 以尼德兰乌得勒支大学心理学家杰弗里·戈得斯坦为例.

sentences.en: The 2002 Nobel Prize in Economics was awarded to psychologist Daniel Kahneman.
sentences.cn: 心理学家DanielKahneman被授予2002年诺贝尔经济学奖.

sentences.en: The psychologist always assigns work to each researcher.
sentences.cn: 这个心理学家总是将工作分派给每个研究人员.

sentences.en: The psychologist explained my problem in homely terms.
sentences.cn: 那位心理学家用浅显的词语解释了我的问题.

sentences.en: This positive interaction is therapeutic , and much less expensive than visits to a psychologist.
sentences.cn: 这种积极的双向行为,犹如—一剂良药, 还比求助于心理学家划算得多.

words.tran_cn: 精神分析的；心理分析的
心理的；心理学的；精神上的
[心理] 心理发生；精神发生
心理测验；心理测定学；心灵占卜术

trans.tran_en: someone who is trained in psychology
